intro: Echinospermum redowskii var. strictum, commonly known as the narrowleaf echinospermum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological adaptations to arid environments.
